workflow.name: Scrape Google Maps by area & generate outreach messages for lead generation
workflow.description:
### This n8n workflow automates lead extraction from Google Maps, enriches data with AI, and stores results for cold outreach.

It uses the [Bright Data](https://brightdata.com/) community node and Bright Data MCP for scraping and AI message generation.

### **How it works**

1. **Form Submission**
    
    User provides Google Maps starting location, keyword and country.
    
2. **Bright Data Scraping**
    
    [Bright Data](https://brightdata.com/) community node triggers a Maps scraping job, monitors progress, and downloads results.
    
3. **AI Message Generation**
    
    Uses Bright Data MCP with LLMs to create a personalized cold call script and talking points for each lead.
    
4. **Database Storage**
    
    Enriched leads and scripts are upserted to Supabase.
    

### **How to use**

Set up all the credentials, create your Postgres table and submit the form. The rest happens automatically.

### **Requirements**

- LLM account (OpenAI, Gemini‚Ä¶) for API usage.
- [Bright Data](https://brightdata.com/) account for API and MCP usage.
- Supabase account (or other Postgres database) to store information.

parameters.formDescription:
Use this form to scrape businesses from Google Maps, based on a starting location.

Make sure to copy the URL from your browser address bar. DO NOT use the Share feature in Google Maps.

parameters.query:
CREATE TABLE business_scraping_result (
    place_id text PRIMARY KEY,
    page_summary TEXT,
    name TEXT,
    category TEXT,
    address TEXT,
    description TEXT,
    google_url TEXT,
    website TEXT,
    phone_number TEXT,
    reviews_count INTEGER,
    rating NUMERIC(2,1),
    services_provided TEXT[],
    top_reviews JSONB,
    sales_helper TEXT
);

parameters.content:
## Retry logic
Retries until the extraction is ready or until the retry limit is reached

messageValues.message:
=You are a business development assistant helping an entrepreneur prepare for a cold call to a business lead.

Take into account that my company segment is: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['My company\'s segment'] }}

# TASK
You will receive structured data about a business, including basic info, services, reviews, and contact details.

Your job is to generate:
1. A short cold call opening message the entrepreneur can use to start the conversation.
2. A list of supportive talking points or insights the entrepreneur can use during the call to sound informed and build rapport.

# OUTPUT STRUCTURE
1. Opening Message (Spoken Script):
- 2‚Äì4 sentences.
- Friendly, confident, respectful tone.
- Show that the caller is familiar with the business.
- Mention something specific (e.g. high rating, food quality, atmosphere, community praise).
- Introduce the caller‚Äôs intention (e.g. connect, collaborate, learn more).

2. Call Support Notes (Bullet List):
- Provide 3‚Äì5 relevant talking points about the business based on reviews, services, and offerings.
- Suggest areas the entrepreneur can mention or ask about (e.g. ‚ÄúYour place seems popular with tourists and locals alike ‚Äî how do you approach that balance?‚Äù)
- Avoid quoting reviews verbatim ‚Äî instead, summarize sentiment or praise.

# INSTRUCTIONS
- Generate a personalized cold call opening message
- Generate a list of insightful, natural talking points to help the entrepreneur carry the conversation confidently

# GUIDELINES
- Output only the results, without any intro or outro text.

parameters.content:
### ‚òùÔ∏è Bright Data MCP
Place your token here
## Run this to create your Supabase table

The `zoom_level` controls the radius of your search. A lower zoom means a higher radius.

The `dataset_id` refers to the [Google Maps scraper](https://brightdata.com/cp/scrapers/api/gd_m8ebnr0q2qlklc02fz/location/) from BrightData

nodes.name: Extract latitude and logitude from URL

parameters.content: Limit the amount of items to save in your database, if you'd like.
A loop is used here to ensure that even if an error occurs with one of the items, all previous items will still be saved in the database.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a web-scraping AI agent equipped with the tool 'scrape_as_markdown'.

# TASK
Scrape the homepage of the provided website and generate a structured summary of the company based on the main content.

## OBJECTIVES
1. Scrape.
2. Extract only the core content of the page.
3. Identify key information:
   - Company mission or vision
   - Products or services offered
   - Target audience or market
   - Key messaging, branding, or positioning
   - Any highlighted achievements, updates, or announcements

## CONSTRAINTS
- Prioritize meaningful textual content over visuals or layout elements.
- Ensure clarity and neutrality in the summary.

# OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS
Return a summary of 300-500 words in the following format:
[Company Name]:

[Summary of company in 300-500 words, clearly structured and written in neutral, informative language.]

parameters.content:
To connect to Supabase using Postgres credentials, just click the `Connect` button in Supabase header and use the `Transaction pooler` parameters.

[Official documentation](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/database/connecting-to-postgres)

To connect to Supabase using Postgres credentials, just click the `Connect` button in Supabase header and use the `Transaction pooler` parameters.

[Official documentation](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/database/connecting-to-postgres)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
